isis.stitle: TSI 06-07-01 - Excessive Start-Up Exhaust Moisture and Soot from 9000i Models with Horizontal Muffler and Vertical Exhaust Pipe Codes 07DBA and 07DBC

subjectgroup.subject: Excessive Start-Up Exhaust Moisture and Soot from 9000i Models with Horizontal Muffler and Vertical Exhaust Pipe Codes 07DBA and 07DBC

geninfo.para: The horizontal muffler may collect moisture from condensation or rain from the vertical exhaust pipe. During start-up and initial acceleration, a wet soot mixture may spray from the vertical exhaust pipe.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.
To avoid personal injury from the muffler and exhaust system allow the vehicle to cool sufficiently before servicing the muffler and exhaust system.

para.emph: NOTE: The following is an accepted repair practice and will allow excess moisture to drain out as necessary.

step1.para: Measure a distance of 18 inches from the rear edge along the bottom surface of the muffler.
Locate the lowest point at the 18 inch distance from the rear (Step 1) and mark the point.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, do not use an electricdrill to perform the next Step. Water may be present in the muffler and may make contact with drill.

step1.para: Drill a 1/4 inch hole through the muffler outer shell with an air powered drill at the point located in Step 2.
